body.note: Installing services requires using the HDPI installer.

ol.li:
Download an RC file for the admin user and project.
Log in to Horizon using the admin account.
Download the OpenStack RC file.
Use scp to copy the RC file over to the Deployer.
SSH to the Deployer and source the RC file. You will need to provide the same admin password that you used to log in to Horizon.
source admin-openrc.sh

The installer retrieves service configuration information from the os-client-config ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml file. If you did not create your clouds.yaml file earlier, follow these steps:
Create this directory:mkdir -p ~/.config/openstack/
Create a plaintext file called ~/.config/openstack/clouds.yaml in that directory.
Enter the configuration information for your installation in the mycloudname and auth sections of the file. A sample configuration file is provided for a starting point.
List the available ALS versions to install.openstack hdpi list --os-cloud mycloud | grep alsThe output should include:| als | wscatalog.2670 | 2.0.0 | available |

Use the ALS version number to view the details of the specific package. The output provides significant administration information such as download size, version, and so forth.openstack hdpi show wscatalog.2670 --os-cloud mycloud The output will appear similar to: +---------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | Field | Value | +---------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ | actions | download | | description | als_2.0.0.517_qcow2.csu - Application Lifecycle Service for HP Helion Development Platform. | | download_size | 5157019481 | | email | | | id | wscatalog.2670 | | name | Application Lifecycle Service | | package_id | g11.2e8ab198-5b0f-4bda-9ec7-8ab9c13b53dd | | provider_name | Hewlett Packard Company | | service | als | | sku | B4CD85EA-742F-B8BA-DD39-3A81EEC89741 | | state | available | | type | PaaS Workloads | | version | 2.0.0 | | webpage | http://www.hp.com/helion/devplatform | +---------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

Run the following command: openstack --os-cloud mycloud hdpi als install --package wscatalog.2670 The output will appear similar to: Application Lifecycle Service is now downloading ... ... Application Lifecycle Service is (downloaded) Application Lifecycle Service is already (available) Application Lifecycle Service is already configured Completed installing application $
